docs.lead_paragraph: We have New-Orleans papers of Tuesday and Wednesday. The decided decrease of the fever was restoring animation in New-Orleans, and the boats had resumed their regular trips up the river. The Crescent, however, says the epidemic is only stayed for want of material, and the papers generally warn strangers from approaching the city.

headline.main: THE SOUTH.; Letters on the Productions, Industry, and Resources of the Slabe States. NUMBER THIRTY-EIGHT.

docs.lead_paragraph: First impressions of New-Orleans... Curious variety in the population.. The free people of slight African Mood... Prostitution, 4c. I was awakened by the loud ringing of a hand-bell, and turning out of my berth, dressed by dim lamp-light.

byline.original: SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE OF THE N.Y. DAILY TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: The Secretary of War returned to Washington on Friday from his excursion to New-England. During his short stop at Hartford, he was complimented by the citizens with an impromptu banquet, at which the Mayor of the city presided, and who welcomed the distinguished guest in an appropriate and cordial address. To this address Col. DAVIS made a brief reply.

headline.main: WOMAN'S RIGHTS.; A Very Merry Measure, to a Very Sober Song.

docs.lead_paragraph: BY A MAN IN HIS HONEYMOON. I. Oh, ladies, will you hear a truth, Of late too seldom told to you:-- Nor deem--he begs it of your ruth--The writer over bold to you. For, by the pulses of his youth, He never yet was cold to you. And, therefore, 'tis in sober sooth, That he would now unfold to you What may,--apart from rhythmic flights,-- Be called, the sum of "Woman's Rights."

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; BOARD OF HEALTH. FIRE. NEW ORLEANS SUFFERERS. CITY MORTALITY. CITY COURT.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF HEALTH.--The Board of Health yesterday refused to permit the ship John W. Minor to land a cargo of rags, cotton, and hides, at the Atlantic Dock. This vessel is from New-Orleans. The Health Officer stated that the cholera was, in October, 1825, introduced into this city by a trunk of clothing, belonging to a man named BAISLEY, who had died with cholera, being sent here from New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reopening of City Churches. Several of the Churches in this City and Brooklyn were reopened yesterday, after undergoing their customary Summer renovations. Grace Church, Breadway, was opened with a discourse by the Rector Rev. THOMAS TAYLOR.
docs.snippet: Reopening of City Churches. Several of the Churches in this City and Brooklyn were reopened yesterday, after undergoing their customary Summer renovations. Grace Church, Breadway, was opened with a discourse by the Rector Rev. THOMAS TAYLOR.

docs.lead_paragraph: In another part of this morning's paper will be found, as is usual on Monday, the list of burials for the week past, as reported to the City Inspector. Referring to that for particulars, we simply design to call attention to some points suggested on glancing over its items. The whole number of deaths was 531, being an increase of 37 over that of last Monday.
